newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - June 4.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - June 4.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Wednesday:
* On Tuesday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 22.75 points or 0.31 percent to close at 7312.15.
* The Kuala Lumpur Composite Index gained 8.86 points or 0.79 percent to 1,126.83.
* Ringgit quoted at 2.5162/72 a dollar at around 0100 GMT, steady from its Kuala Lumpur ending on Tuesday at 2.5160/70.
* Financial services firm Berjaya Capital reported net profit of 166.40 million ringgit for the year ended April 30, against 108.31 million previously.
* Construction conglomerate Renong said it has signed a put option on 112 million Time Engineering to help Time fund some acquisitions.
* Power firm Tenaga was reported to have received approval to hive off two units -- a power plant operating firm and an energy consultancy unit.
* Property developer and industrial concern Wembley says it cannot explain why its stock surged in heavy volume in recent days.
